title: Marijuana

resource.description: Strong support for legalized marijuana, less for mandatory health care coverage, and mixed reviews on the CCC.

body:
This is an early April number and 40% of respondents think legalization has had a positive impact on the state. That’s the single largest segment of the electorate, 10% higher than negative impact and when combined with those who see no impact that’s 70% to 30% for the roll out to date. Not bad, and likely to get better as reefer madness fails to materialize.

What impact do you believe the legalization of marijuana has had statewide? 4/19 Emerson state D primary

```
Positive impact	40%
```

```
Negative impact	30%	70%-30% no impact 
```

```
No impact		30% 
```

No state agency gets good numbers so 43% to 25% positive is probably as good a place as any to benchmark this crew. Let’s see what it looks like in six months, if it’s on the slide look for a call for new commissioners. 

How would you rate the job the Cannabis Control Commission is doing in legalizing retail marijuana stores? 12/18 MPG state general ivr N=444 (IVR) moe 5% 

```
Excellent, they are trying to protect the public 				16% 
```

```

```

```

```

```

```

```

```

Medical coverage for medical users is heading in the right direction but needs a few more years before it’s politically ripe.
